sentences.english: He could hear two men walking around the Upper Library, dusting the bookshelves with fly- whisks .
sentences.chinese: 只聽得兩個人走進書房，揮拂塵四下裏拂拭。

sentences.english: I am not huge on decorations that I have to dust or clean all the time.
sentences.chinese: 我不掛飾物，這樣就不用整天爲它們拂塵做清潔。

sentences.english: You can do this with a wire whisk or I like to use a hand mixer.
sentences.chinese: 您可以用鋼絲拂塵或我喜歡用一隻手調音臺。

definition: to present a treasure/to offer a valuable piece of advice/to show off what one treasures
Liuying township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
waistband of a skirt/(fig.) related to the wife or another female family member
(literary) to practice medicine/to work as a pharmacist
rotating disk/wheel/rotor/cycle of reincarnation in Buddhism
high-quality ink stonemade in Duanxi and Guangdong
to lie in disarray/to cut across/to traverse
embroidered headband used as decoration by actors or in Hui ethnic group/to reward an actor with brocade headband
